00026 
00027 //
00028 // Another implementation of the Rijndael cipher.
00029 // This is intended to be an easily usable library file.
00030 // Based on the Vincent Rijmen and K.U.Leuven implementation 2.4.
00031 //
00032 
00033 //
00034 // Original Copyright notice:
00035 //
00036 //    rijndael-alg-fst.c   v2.4   April '2000
00037 //    rijndael-alg-fst.h
00038 //    rijndael-api-fst.c
00039 //    rijndael-api-fst.h
00040 //
00041 //    Optimised ANSI C code
00042 //
00043 //    authors: v1.0: Antoon Bosselaers
00044 //             v2.0: Vincent Rijmen, K.U.Leuven
00045 //             v2.3: Paulo Barreto
00046 //             v2.4: Vincent Rijmen, K.U.Leuven
00047 //
00048 //    This code is placed in the public domain.
00049 //
00050 
00051 //
00052 // This implementation works on 128, 192, 256 bit keys
00053 // and on 128 bit blocks
00054 //
00055 
00056 //
00057 // Example of usage:
00058 //
00059 //  // Input data
00060 //      unsigned char key[32];                       // The key
00061 //  initializeYour256BitKey();                   // Obviously initialized with sth
00062 //  const unsigned char * plainText = getYourPlainText(); // Your plain text
00063 //  int plainTextLen = strlen(plainText);        // Plain text length
00064 //
00065 //  // Encrypting
00066 //      Rijndael rin;
00067 //  unsigned char output[plainTextLen + 16];
00068 //
00069 //      rin.init(Rijndael::CBC,Rijndael::Encrypt,key,Rijndael::Key32Bytes);
00070 //  // It is a good idea to check the error code
00071 //      int len = rin.padEncrypt(plainText,len,output);
00072 //  if(len >= 0)useYourEncryptedText();
00073 //  else encryptError(len);
00074 //
00075 //  // Decrypting: we can reuse the same object
00076 //      unsigned char output2[len];
00077 //      rin.init(Rijndael::ECB,Rijndael::Decrypt,keyMaterial,Rijndael::Key32Bytes));
00078 //      len = rin.padDecrypt(output,len,output2);
00079 //  if(len >= 0)useYourDecryptedText();
00080 //  else decryptError(len);
00081 //
00082 
00083 #include "kvi_settings.h"
00084 
00085 #if defined(COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT) || defined(Q_MOC_RUN)
00086 
00087 #define _MAX_KEY_COLUMNS (256/32)
00088 #define _MAX_ROUNDS      14
00089 //#define BITSPERBLOCK        128 /* Default number of bits in a cipher block */
00090 #define MAX_IV_SIZE      16
00091 #define STRICT_ALIGN 0
00092 
00093 // We assume that unsigned int is 32 bits long....
00094 typedef unsigned char  UINT8;
00095 typedef unsigned int   UINT32;
00096 typedef unsigned short UINT16;
00097 
00098 #define RIJNDAEL_SUCCESS 0
00099 #define RIJNDAEL_UNSUPPORTED_MODE -1
00100 #define RIJNDAEL_UNSUPPORTED_DIRECTION -2
00101 #define RIJNDAEL_UNSUPPORTED_KEY_LENGTH -3
00102 #define RIJNDAEL_BAD_KEY -4
00103 #define RIJNDAEL_NOT_INITIALIZED -5
00104 #define RIJNDAEL_BAD_DIRECTION -6
00105 #define RIJNDAEL_CORRUPTED_DATA -7
00106 
00107 class Rijndael
00108 {
00109 public:
00110         enum Direction { Encrypt, Decrypt };
00111         enum Mode { ECB, CBC, CFB1 };
00112         enum KeyLength { Key16Bytes, Key24Bytes, Key32Bytes };
00113 
00114         Rijndael();
00115         ~Rijndael();
00116 protected:
00117         enum State { Valid, Invalid };
00118 
00119         State     m_state;
00120         Mode      m_mode;
00121         Direction m_direction;
00122         UINT8     m_initVector[MAX_IV_SIZE];
00123         UINT32    m_uRounds;
00124         UINT8     m_expandedKey[_MAX_ROUNDS+1][4][4];
00125 public:
00126         // Initializes the crypt session
00127         // Returns RIJNDAEL_SUCCESS or an error code
00128         int init(Mode mode,Direction dir,const UINT8 *key,KeyLength keyLen,UINT8 * initVector = 0);
00129         // Input len is in BITS!
00130         // Encrypts inputLen / 128 blocks of input and puts it in outBuffer
00131         // outBuffer must be at least inputLen / 8 bytes long.
00132         // Returns the encrypted buffer length in BITS or an error code < 0 in case of error
00133         int blockEncrypt(const UINT8 *input, int inputLen, UINT8 *outBuffer, UINT8 * initVector = 0);
00134         // Input len is in BYTES!
00135         // outBuffer must be at least inputLen + 16 bytes long
00136         // Returns the encrypted buffer length in BYTES or an error code < 0 in case of error
00137         int padEncrypt(const UINT8 *input, int inputOctets, UINT8 *outBuffer, UINT8 * initVector = 0);
00138         // Input len is in BITS!
00139         // outBuffer must be at least inputLen / 8 bytes long
00140         // Returns the decrypted buffer length in BITS and an error code < 0 in case of error
00141         int blockDecrypt(const UINT8 *input, int inputLen, UINT8 *outBuffer, UINT8 * initVector = 0);
00142         // Input len is in BYTES!
00143         // outBuffer must be at least inputLen bytes long
00144         // Returns the decrypted buffer length in BYTES and an error code < 0 in case of error
00145         int padDecrypt(const UINT8 *input, int inputOctets, UINT8 *outBuffer, UINT8 * initVector = 0);
00146 protected:
00147         void keySched(UINT8 key[_MAX_KEY_COLUMNS][4]);
00148         void keyEncToDec();
00149         void encrypt(const UINT8 a[16], UINT8 b[16]);
00150         void decrypt(const UINT8 a[16], UINT8 b[16]);
00151         void updateInitVector(UINT8 * initVector = 0);
00152 };
00153 
00154 #endif // COMPILE_CRYPT_SUPPORT
00155 
00156 #endif // _RIJNDAEL_H_
